page.title: 04LEAD MINING IN MONYASH
page.content: { Monyash}was the centre of the lead-mining industry in the{High {Peak}area of Derbyshire.There are about 20 disused shafts and probably many more that have been forgotten about.These are particulaly dangerous.Grassy mounds can be seen in many places.These are the remains of the 'deads' _ waste from the old mines. The{Barmote Court}met at the{Bulls {Head}(now The Hobbit Inn) twice a year.{Hillocks and Knotlow Mines}were mined from 1702 until the last half of the 19th century.The village grew because of the lead mining.Local industries grew to support the lead-miners _ candle-makers, rope-makers,blacksmiths and pubs. Mr{Charlie Millington}who died in 1968, aged 90, was the last of the Derbyshire lead-miners.
